commentary_data: RR take on Delhi today. Both teams are coming on the back of losses. RR started off on an aggressive note in their first game. But they lost their last game against Punjab despite the heroics from Jurel and Hetmyer. DC on the other hand have spiralled to two losses. Their campaign was hit badly when Pant got ruled out before IPL 2023. And I guess they haven't been able to figure their best combination just yet.
I0$ The top 3, Chahal, Hetmyer and the latest sensation Jurel! Their bowling attack went for plenty in the last game but can be seen as an aberration.

Only an optimist might be able to point it out. Even the Warner fifty in the first game came at a sluggish pace. Axar Patel has been in good form and would be one man who might well have to bail DC out of the current big hole that they are in.

The pitch that's been used today was used for the India-South Africa T20I where 450+ runs were scored. It's the centre pitch, 65m on both sides and longer straight boundaries. The pitch is brilliant, it might not be as good a wicket to bat on though, it's darker which means a bit more moisture, there are indentations and ridges which run parallel to each other because of the process of scarification, which has ensured a few marks. It's still a very good pitch to bat, but it might help the spinners to get some grip. batting first might be the way to go about today, reckons Deep Dasgupta, in his .

It was a quick turnaround, but felt quite good to be back and playing the game. We took our flight overnight so the time difference was ideal because I got to sleep on the flight. Unfortunate about how the last game panned out but was nice to get out there and be with the team again. The talk has been about doing the basics right and doing it for long periods, trying to partnerships up front with the bat, trying to build partnerships with the ball as well. Obviously the more wickets we can take the better, but also trying to restrict the opposition as much as we can and get some momentum going. (On powerplay bowling) Definitely important, we can build some sort of pressure, the more wickets we can get. It is a big focus for us.

I0$ KM Asif's role in the team has been to bowl with the new ball and chip in at the death. But he was very expensive in the last game. Barring that the experience in the bowling attack can make any team envious.
I0$ The list is too long. DC haven't had their batting and bowling department firing at all. They need a much improved performance today.
Our early bird Goks says - I0$

Another flat bed is expected to be doled out for today's game. Batters should be able to relish the 22 yards and the shorter fences. And there is enough artillery and ammunition we should see today as both sides boast of some of the biggest T20 mercenaries.

As far as squads are concerned. Can't see RR making any changes. May be Asif might give way to Saini or may be Sandeep Sharma. Padikkal's position in the batting order is a little bit of a concern as well. And as for DC, can't fathom how many changes can they make to turn this around? I would leave it to you peeps to put on the selector's hat!

Don't know what's gonna happen. Hopefully we will start well. Marsh has gone home to get married. All the best to him. There is one forced change with Powell coming in for Marsh. There are changes. Lalit comes in as well for Sarfraz. Manish Pandey comes in.

I think it looks a good wicket to bat on. Should be a high scoring game. Let's see how we turn up. With the impact rule, we can balance the side both ways. We can kind of manage. Jos is alright. We have a couple of changes. I am a bit confused. I will have to see the sheet as it keeps changing thanks to the impact rule.
(Playing XI): Jos Buttler, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Sanju Samson(w/c), Riyan Parag, Shimron Hetmyer, Dhruv Jurel, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jason Holder, Trent Boult, Sandeep Sharma, Yuzvendra Chahal
(Playing XI): David Warner(c), Manish Pandey, Rilee Rossouw, Rovman Powell, Lalit Yadav, Axar Patel, Abishek Porel(w), Anrich Nortje, Khaleel Ahmed, Kuldeep Yadav, Mukesh Kumar
Navdeep Saini, Akash Vasisht, Murugan Ashwin, KM Asif, Donavon Ferreira
Aman Hakim Khan, Prithvi Shaw, Sarfaraz Khan, Ishant Sharma, Praveen Dubey
The DC players get into a huddle and now stride out. RR openers Buttler and Jaiswal follow behind, can they get their team off to a flier? Khaleel has the new ball for Delhi...

Khaleel Ahmed to Jaiswal, , Jaiswal starts off with a bang!! He got a first ball six against PBKS, this time a first ball four!! Short pitched and comes slow after hitting the deck, pulled through mid-wicket for a boundary...

Khaleel Ahmed to Jaiswal, , shoddy fielding! This is short and rose steeply, Jaiswal does well to control his cut to the right of point. Mukesh Kumar is the man at third-man, misjudges the bounce and gifts a boundary...
Khaleel Ahmed to Jaiswal, , a hat-trick of fours!! This is too full on off, Jaiswal opens the bat face on the drive to get it through extra cover for a boundary...
Khaleel Ahmed to Jaiswal, no run, on a length onto off, driven but in the direction of the cover fielder

Khaleel Ahmed to Jaiswal, , Yashasvi Jaiswal showing the full range here!! This is pitched up onto off, Jaiswal shuffles in and takes it under the bat to swing down the ground. Mid-on is too wide to have a say...
Khaleel Ahmed to Jaiswal, , make that five!! Back of length with width, Jaiswal waits and expertly steers his cut over the short third fielder for a boundary.
Nortje to Buttler, no run, fuller length and slightly skiddy on off. Buttler defends towards point
Nortje to Buttler, no run, fuller length and slightly skiddy on off. Buttler defends towards point
Nortje to Buttler, no run, on a length and straight, nice line from Nortje. Defended towards covers
Nortje to Buttler, , on a length but offered some width. Buttler frees his arms with the drive that goes between short cover and point. He's off the mark with a boundary as well...
Nortje to Buttler, no run, yorker length on the pads, turned towards mid-wicket
Nortje to Buttler, , full and quick outside off. Buttler had a slash and it takes a thick outside edge that flies over short third and into the boundary fence.
Nortje to Buttler, , another one! On a length on off, not too much wrong with the ball and Buttler just offers a gentle push that goes through extra cover and mid-off.
Mukesh Kumar to Jaiswal, no run, on a length and slightly skiddy onto the thigh pad. Jaiswal charged out and pushed this towards mid-wicket
Mukesh Kumar to Jaiswal, 1 run, This was pitched fuller on off, Jaiswal with a tap and run towards mid-off
Mukesh Kumar to Buttler, no run, full and skids onto off. Defended. I0$
Mukesh Kumar to Buttler, , up and over. Slightly wider and fuller from Mukesh Kumar. Buttler isn't going to ignore this, slams it over wide mid-off for a boundary. One bounce and over...
Mukesh Kumar to Buttler, 1 run, pitched fuller and was the effort ball. Buttler with a shimmy and clips it in time towards fine leg
Mukesh Kumar to Jaiswal, 1 run, shorter length on off, cut behind square but this time stopped by the third-man fielder
Change of ends for Khaleel
Khaleel Ahmed to Jaiswal, , new end, same treatment. Too wide and full from Khaleel Ahmed, Jaiswal drives it into the ground and over the point fielder for another boundary
Khaleel Ahmed to Jaiswal, , wide yorker, turns out to be too wide...
Khaleel Ahmed to Jaiswal, no run, good length outside off, Jaiswal goes for a big slash but can't connect
Khaleel was too predictable with his lengths in the first over, the sooner he mix up his lengths the better it is for him and DC!!
Khaleel Ahmed to Jaiswal, 1 run, yorker length on off, dug out towards mid-off for a single
Khaleel Ahmed to Buttler, no run, slower length ball, ends down the leg side.
Khaleel Ahmed to Buttler, no run, slower length ball, ends down the leg side.
Khaleel Ahmed to Buttler, 1 run, on the boots, clipped towards fine leg for a single
Khaleel Ahmed to Jaiswal, , oops! Jaiswal backed away and Khaleel followed him. Still ends down leg side and the keeper goes very well to parry that towards fine leg

Khaleel Ahmed to Buttler, 2 runs,  Put down!! This was another pitched up slower delivery, Buttler went for a big slog but didn't time it well. Got plenty of elevation and Nortje from mid-on kept running back. He got to the ball and had a juggle, but couldn't hold on. Always tough to catch these, but Buttler gets a life..
Buttler and Jaiswal make a destructive opening pair. They have the ability to provide such fliers and they have done this consistently too!
Axar to Jaiswal, no run, fired into leg, swept but well stopped by square leg diving to his left
Axar to Jaiswal, no run, arm ball that goes outside off. Jaiswal goes for the sweep and misses
Axar to Jaiswal, , Jaiswal got ready early for the switch hit. Axar Patel saw that and fired it onto his boots. The batter gets an underedge that runs away to the third-man boundary
Axar to Jaiswal, , superb shot!! This was flat on leg, Jaiswal backed away to play the cut and gets it between point and short third
Axar to Jaiswal, , once again a hat-trick of fours!! This was fired in again, Jaiswal expected that, got low and swept it over square leg. A couple of bounces before going over...
Axar to Jaiswal, 1 run, quick and full on middle, driven towards long-on
Since Buttler has gloved that (3.4), why is it not a wicket? 'Because it didn't carry to the keeper'
Nortje to Jaiswal, no run, full and angling in from round the wicket. Jaiswal slightly beaten for pace as he edges it onto his pads
Nortje to Jaiswal, no run, on a length on off, punched towards mid-off
Nortje to Jaiswal, 1 run, fuller on off, Jaiswal with a tame push towards mid-off for a single. Takes off instantly sensing Warner was a bit wider
Nortje to Buttler, , yorker length, slightly underpitched and Buttler very easily lifts it over mid-off for a boundary. Makes cricket look so easy...
Nortje to Buttler, no run, good length just outside off, punched a tad uppishly - one bounce towards point
Nortje to Buttler, no run, slower delivery, pushed towards extra cover. A rare quiet over, only 5 comes off it

Will mid-season trades be allowed in the IPL this season? If yes then he should be moved on to a team where he can open, as he's too talented to sit on the bench. It can also allow Rajasthan to bolster their Indian middle order players. 'They did have a couple of seasons ago'
Axar to Jaiswal, 1 run, on a length and gets no spin, Jaiswal shuffles in and punches it towards long-on
Axar to Buttler, 1 run, arm ball onto the thigh pad, turned towards mid-wicket
Axar to Jaiswal, no run, flat delivery, Jaiswal charged out but checked himself to defend
Axar to Jaiswal, , goes on with the arm outside off, cut square of the wicket by Jaiswal and beats the dive of sweeper cover
Axar to Jaiswal, , lovely shot!! Once again flat on the pads, not too much wrong with the delivery. Jaiswal stays back and pulls between deep mid-wicket and long-on.
What's wrong with Kuldeep Sen? Why hasn't he played a single match yet? 'He's still recuperating from a back injury'
Axar to Jaiswal, 1 run, short on the thigh pad, turned towards deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Jaiswal, 1 run, quicker and full, Jaiswal charged out and pushes it towards long-off

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, , unlucky!! This was a very wide half tracker. Buttler goes chasing and gets an underedge that runs away to the third-man boundary. Nothing keeper or fielder could have done there
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, flat on the pads, turned towards deep mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Jaiswal, , tossed up on leg, Jaiswal shuffled away and charged out to get under the ball. Hoists his drive over long-off and into the stands. Looked like a mishit on first viewing, but easily cleared the fence...
Kuldeep Yadav to Jaiswal, 1 run, flat and skids on, pushed towards long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, , flat and was seam up onto the thigh pad. Buttler adjusts to pull it behind square and it races away to the fence again. RR almost at 100 and only 8 overs have been bowled...
Mukesh Kumar to Jaiswal, 1 run, full and straight, Jaiswal gives the bowler a charge and drives towards long-on
Mukesh Kumar to Buttler, 1 run, nice yorker, turned towards square leg
Can we have Jaiswal and Samson in India T20 team please. Leave out non-performers.
Mukesh Kumar to Jaiswal,  Caught&Bowled!!

Mukesh Kumar to Jaiswal,  Caught&Bowled!! There comes the wicket! Very smart from Mukesh Kumar as he went for a surprise bouncer after seeing Jaiswal charge out. Bent his back on that and got the extra pace, hurried the southpaw who top-edged his pull only for an easy caught and bowled chance.
Mukesh Kumar to Samson, no run, back of a length and straight, defended to the right of the bowler
Mukesh Kumar to Samson, no run, full and straight, Samson with a shimmy defends it back to the bowler
Mukesh Kumar to Samson, no run, another nice bouncer, Samson backed away and let it pass. Thought it was too high but the umpires were happy with it...
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 2 runs, tossed up on the pads, turned to the right of long-on for a couple of runs. Smart running...
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, flighted outside off, goes on with the arm. A swing and a miss for Buttler
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 2 runs, quicker onto leg, Buttler turns to square leg with soft hands for another couple of runs. Placed and timed perfectly to enable the second run...
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, full and skids outside off, pushed towards covers for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson,  Caught!!

Kuldeep Yadav to Samson,  Caught by Nortje!! A duck for Sanju Samson and the assist for this wicket goes to Mukesh Kumar. He tied up the RR captain with three dots, and Samson decided to heave it over long-on as Yadav flighted it up. Off to bottom of the bat and holes out to long-on. Not very smart from Sanju, DC can sense a route back now...
Out walks the local boy, and he's got a promotion to 4 today. Can Riyan Parag make this game count?
Kuldeep Yadav to Riyan Parag, no run, almost another wicket!! Quicker onto off, Parag tried to clip it leg side and got a leading edge. Falls short and to the left of Kuldeep's dive

This has been the problem with Jaiswal constantly. Gets amazing starts, scores a 50 as quickly as possible and gets out immediately. He should learn to convert his great starts to something big. 'That's the nature of T20 cricket'
Axar to Buttler, no run, flat, punched straight to extra cover
Axar to Buttler, 1 run, arm ball, Buttler waits on the backfoot and turns to mid-wicket
Axar to Riyan Parag, no run, flat on off, pushed to extra cover
Axar to Riyan Parag, 1 run, short and wider, punched square of the wicket to get off the mark
Axar to Buttler, 1 run, quicker outside off, cut towards the sweeper
Axar to Riyan Parag, 1 run, arm ball, pushed towards long-on.
Axar to Riyan Parag, 1 run, arm ball, pushed towards long-on.
Kuldeep Yadav to Riyan Parag, 1 run, short of length, Parag went back for a big slog but inside halves towards square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, half tracker, pulled along the ground towards deep square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Riyan Parag, 1 run, fuller and turns away, Parag guides it towards point for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, full outside off, Buttler goes for the reverse sweep but finds short third
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, full on off, pushed towards extra cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 2 runs, flat delivery on leg, Buttler goes for the reverse sweep again and gets it to the right of backward point. Cut off by the man at deep extra cover.
Axar to Riyan Parag, 1 run, flat delivery, slammed towards long-on
Axar to Buttler, , six after 25 deliveries!! Short on middle, Buttler goes back to pull it over cow corner and for a maximum. That's also his 50!!
Axar to Buttler, no run, fired into off, pushed to extra cover
Axar to Buttler, 1 run, flat and wide, cut towards the sweeper for a single
Axar to Riyan Parag, 1 run, flat and gets some extra bounce outside off, punched down to long-on
Delhi hasn't looked solid from the time they released Dhawan and Iyer from the team, starting to think if they were the ones who were holding the team together.
Axar to Buttler, 1 run, fuller on off, turned to extra cover for a single
Anither change from DC as they get Powell to bowl - he's bowling for the 1st time in #IPL2023
Powell to Buttler, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, pushed into the gap wide of cover for a single
Powell to Riyan Parag, , the slower ball from Powell, but he slips it down leg, called as a wide
Powell to Riyan Parag, no run, on a good length and just outside off, hint of shape back into the right-hander who stabs it down
Powell to Riyan Parag, no run, on a good length and just outside off, hint of shape back into the right-hander who stabs it down
Riyan Parag has another opportunity to showcase his abilities and justify the RR management's faith.
Powell to Riyan Parag, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, Parag miscues the hack to long-on for a single
Powell to Buttler, 1 run, loopy full-toss, was dropping down onto Buttler, pulled away past square leg for a single
Powell to Riyan Parag,  Bowled!!

Powell to Riyan Parag,  Bowled!! Powell has broken through for DC - an ugly hoick from Parag, was looking to swing it over mid-wicket and missed it completely, another failure for him, but this will bring in Shimron Hetmyer - pace on this delivery from Powell, kept coming back with the angle and splattered into the stumps.
Powell to Hetmyer, no run, on a good length and just outside off, eased into the off-side, straight to the fielder at cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, tossed up and spinning away from outside off - Buttler reaches out and mistimes the cut to the off-side
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 2 runs, slower and wider of off, Buttler reaches out on the drive and slices it over cover, comes back for the second run
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, Buttler brings out the reverse sweep, rolled his wrists and found the fielder at backward point, he'll feel he missed out there

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, dropped slightly short and just outside off, punched to cover and Buttler sets off for a quick single - a slight fumble from Warner does help the batters to reach their ends safely
Kuldeep Yadav to Hetmyer, no run, flighted delivery outside off, Hetmyer stays back and punches it straight to the fielder at cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Hetmyer, 1 run, dropped short by Kuldeep, pulled down to long-on for a single
will get the Royals to 180, they looked like easily going past 200 at one time, DC have clawed back, can they finish well?
Mukesh Kumar to Hetmyer, 1 run, fuller length delivery on off, driven past cover for a single
Mukesh Kumar to Buttler, leg byes, 1 run, Mukesh has been so good today, spots Buttler backing away and follows him with a leg-stump yorker, off the pad and rolled to the on-side for a leg-bye
Mukesh Kumar to Hetmyer, 1 run, Mukesh keeps it very full once again, Hetmyer clears his front leg and drives it through mid-wicket for a single
Mukesh Kumar to Hetmyer, 1 run, Mukesh keeps it very full once again, Hetmyer clears his front leg and drives it through mid-wicket for a single
Mukesh Kumar to Buttler, 2 runs, fuller length delivery at the stumps, Buttler stays leg-sided and drags the on-drive, to the right of long-on and he's back for the second
Brilliant captaincy from david warner..the way he has managed his bowlers with calmness after the early storm of jaiswal and buttler... now all he needs is a big score.. hopefully today
Mukesh Kumar to Buttler, , , a low full-toss from Kumar - Buttler gets down low and then paddles it over backward square leg, bounces away to the ropes in a hurry

Mukesh Kumar to Buttler, , , very full and at the stumps, nothing wrong with the ball, but Buttler has backed away, opens up his arms and drives it like a sledgehammer, back past the umpire and giving long-on no chance,

Powell to Hetmyer, , fuller length delivery and angling across the left-hander, close to the tramlines and Hetmyer lets it go - not called as a wide and , but Powell has overstepped first, the siren rings and
Powell to Hetmyer, 1 run, fuller length delivery on off, Hetmyer can't get completely under it on the slog-swipe, holes out to long-on and it's just a single
Powell, from round the wicket

Powell to Buttler, 1 run, on a good length and angling across the right-hander, Buttler opens up his front leg and swings it over mid-wicket, didn't get hold of the shot and it bounces through to deep mid-wicket
Powell to Hetmyer, , Powell misses his length and is duly punished - length ball and Hetmyer smashes it back over the bowler's head, sails all the way over the ropes for a boundary
Powell to Hetmyer, , , Powell has started to leak runs, full and wide of off, but Hetmyer can get under it and then drills the drive wide of extra-cover, long-off can't get across to cut it off
Powell to Hetmyer, no run, Hetmyer will feel he missed out there, full-toss outside off and he drills it straight to the fielder at extra-cover
Powell to Hetmyer, 1 run, the wide full-toss from Powell - Hetmyer was coming down the pitch, reaches out and drives it to deep cover for a single
Nortje back..

Nortje to Hetmyer, no run, .. a swing and a miss, didn't miss the off-stump by much, Nortje came from round the wicket and angles one across the left-hander - Hetmyer was looking to swing it over mid-wicket and missed

Nortje to Hetmyer, 1 run, that'll go down as a half-chance, a slightly high full-toss, Hetmyer was late on the flick and the leading edge lobbed high over mid-wicket - Lalit didn't spot it early, then had to race in, got to the ball and then spilled it
Nortje to Buttler, , , funky moves from Buttler - shuffles across the stumps, used Nortje's pace and then lapped it very fine - long leg is square and has no chance
Nortje to Buttler, 2 runs, fuller length delivery on the pads, flicked away behind square on the on-side for a couple of runs
Nortje to Buttler, no run, change of pace from Nortje - slightly slower and just outside off - Buttler was shaping for the reverse pull and missed
Nortje to Buttler, no run, change of pace from Nortje - slightly slower and just outside off - Buttler was shaping for the reverse pull and missed

Nortje to Buttler, , even Nortje is starting to travel, misses the yorker, turns out to be a low full-toss - Buttler didn't hit it cleanly, but mid-off was in the ring and the ball bounced over him to the ropes,
Even if RR gets past 200, they will be disappointed for that middle overs' collapse.
Mukesh Kumar to Hetmyer, , , on a good length and at the stumps, Mukesh missed the yorker and he's made to pay - Hetmyer gets under the shovel and sends it soaring over mid-wicket for a maximum
Mukesh Kumar to Hetmyer, 1 run, change of pace from Mukesh - on a length and it's dragged away past square leg for a single
Mukesh Kumar to Buttler,  Caught&Bowled!!

Mukesh Kumar to Buttler,  Caught&Bowled!! That's a strange dismissal, but that'll please DC. Was a yorker length delivery at the stumps, Buttler jammed the bat down and squeezed it back at the bowler - Mukesh takes the catch and he's asking for a dismissal - he reckons that the ball came right back at him. Actually, it looks like he's chipped it back to the bowler, who has juggled once and taken it on the rebound. Replays in and it's clearly come off the toe-end, not sure Mukesh realised it either- threw the ball at the keeper and then turned around in a soft appeal.
Mukesh Kumar to Dhruv Jurel, , , the slower ball from Mukesh, but it's right in the slot - Jurel shuffles across, picked the length and clears wide mid-wicket with a classy whip
Mukesh Kumar to Dhruv Jurel, 1 run, fuller length delivery on off, punched down to long-on for a single
Mukesh Kumar to Hetmyer, 1 run, yorker length delivery at the stumps, worked wide of mid-wicket for a single
Nortje to Hetmyer, , , back of a length and just outside off - Hetmyer shuffles across and then swings the arm around on the pull, sends it sailing - high and over mid-wicket for a maximum
Nortje to Hetmyer, 1 run, Nortje goes full and at the stumps, driven down to long-on for a single
Nortje to Dhruv Jurel, 1 run, back of a length and angling onto Jurel's hips,  he swivels across and miscues the pull, but it landed well in front of long leg

Nortje to Hetmyer, , , this ain't great bowling form Nortje - mid-off was inside the ring and he has a bowled a slower short ball, we outside off and it's carved away over the fielder, over the ropes for a maximum
Nortje to Hetmyer, 2 runs, low full-toss from Nortje, driven back over his head and straight of mid-off - long-on gets across and keeps them down to a couple
Nortje to Hetmyer, no run, Nortje ends well and , yorker length delivery at the stumps, Hetmyer jams the bat down and squeezes an under-edge that rolls back at the bowler,

The Royals have finished with a more than competitive score on the board, but this is the same pitch which saw India and South Africa plunder 450+ in a T20I not so long ago. You'd think they aren't out of the contest, especially with their fearsome batting line-up. It all started with Jaiswal launching into Khaleel, hitting him for 5 fours in the very first over. He was to race away to a 25-ball half-century and when he was finally dismissed, the Royals were already racing along. His dismissal and that of Samson meant that the Capitals found a way back and they did keep the scoring under check. At 130 for 3 after 15 overs, the Royals seemed to have wasted a great start, but Buttler and Hetmyer were in and they ensured that the final 5 overs did matter - 69 runs and the Royals have fallen just one shy of 200. Mukesh Kumar was the best bowler on view, cleverly mixing his lengths and his pace, but the others went for runs. Can DC chase down 200 and get their first points of #IPL2023? Back for the chase shortly..
We're back for the chase and DC have made the impact call - . He's out with David Warner and their team will hope for a good start. Boult to start for the Royals, a slip in place

Cut my finger in the last game but a few stitches and good to play. (On Orange Cap) Nice to wear, but just glad to get a decent start to the season. This is a good wicket, so we need to bowl well to defend this. The powerplay was fantastic, but the bounce got lower as the ball got older and we lost some momentum in the middle-overs by losing a couple of wickets, hope Ashwin and Chahal could do the same for us. (On getting spin on early) It is a possibility, we’ve built a squad where everyone is comfortable bowling anywhere, so that’s an option but obviously Trent Boult has been bowling really well as well.
Boult to Prithvi Shaw, no run, short of a length and at the hips, Shaw loosk to flick and misses, off the thigh-pad and rollls to the man placed at short square leg
Boult to Prithvi Shaw, no run, Boult shortens the length and gets it to nip away slightly - Shaw was opened up by the angle as he looked to flick, thudded high into the thigh-pad
Boult to Prithvi Shaw,  Caught!!

Boult to Prithvi Shaw,  Caught by Samson!! That's a corker from Samson and the impact substitute has been dismissed for a duck. Full and a hint of shape away from off - Shaw's feet went nowhere as he aimed at an expansive drive, gets a thick edge that flew to the keeper's right - it wasn't carrying to the lone slip, was wide of him as well, was travelling and Samson had to throw himself to his right, did so with his right mitss and the ball stuck, he did well to hold on even as he tumbled across.
Two in two for Boult - Manish has been given  and he's decided to review, after a long chat with his captain.
Boult to Manish Pandey,  Lbw!!

Boult to Manish Pandey,  Lbw!! Two in two for Boult - Manish has been given  and he's decided to review, after a long chat with his captain. Oh dear! This doesn't look too good for the number 3, don't think there's an inside edge and UltraEdge confirms it Onto ball-tracking: The impact is in front of middle and it's crashing into the leg-stump - the on-field call will stay and DC have been rocked. A tragic start for the Capitals - the inswinger and Manish was attempting an ambitious on-drive, didn't account for the movement and fell across on the shot, loud shout and the umpire took his time before raising the finger.
Hat-trick ball - three slips in place
Boult to Rossouw, no run, , on a good length and shaping away from outside off - has Rossouw playing the line, but this one angles in and then curves away past the outside edge, unplayable stuff
Boult to Rossouw, no run, on a good length and at the stumps, defended back at the bowler
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, , wayward start from Sandeep, spills it miles down leg and is called as a wide
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, , wayward start from Sandeep, spills it miles down leg and is called as a wide
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, no run, this new ball is talking for RR - short of a good length and seaming away sharply from outside off, has Warner poking aimlessly anbd beats him by a mile
One slip in place
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, no run, on a good length and around the off-stump line, defended to the off-side
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, no run, fuller length delivery on the pads, clipped straight to the fielder at mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, no run, , on a good length and shaping away from off, draws Warner forward and then swings away past the outside edge
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, , , that should bring some relief for Warner - fraction short and he's quick on the pull, swivels across and then places it wide of mid-wicket for a boundary
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, no run, on a good length and angling across the left-hander, steered straight to the fielder at cover-point
Boult to Rossouw, , , back of a length and well wide of off, Rossouw's feet didn't go anywhere as he went chasing after it, sliced it in the air and to the left of Hetmyer at backward point
Boult to Rossouw, 1 run, on a good length and slanting into the pads, worked behind square on the on-side for a single
Boult to Warner, , , short and wide of off, Warner gets on top of the bounce and crunches the cut past cover-point, no one moved as the ball raced away
Boult to Warner, no run, fuller length delivery and well wide odf off, Warner leans across and toe-ends the drive to cover
Boult to Warner, no run, Boult keeps it full and at the stumps, Warner has the swing covered as he drives it to mid-on
Boult to Warner, no run, fuller length delivery on off, Warner prods forward and pushes it to mid-on
Time for spin and it's Ashwin
Same story every year for Shaw , brilliant in domestic circuit but failure in IPL.
Ashwin to Rossouw, no run, flighted delivery on off, Rossouw gets his bqat in front of the pad as he defended
Ashwin to Rossouw, no run, pushed through with the arm, Rossouw prods across and then pushes it off the back-foot to cover
Sad to see players like Shaw, Parag and Padikkal struggle.

Ashwin to Rossouw, 1 run, beautifully bowled, slowed down the pace, got the ball to drift and then held it back - Rossouw was shaping for an expansive shot, changes his mind and drops it towards cover for a single
Ashwin to Warner, , . tad too short form Ashwin - Warner rocks back and then hammers the pull wide of mid-on. one bounce and over the ropes
Ashwin to Warner, , . tad too short form Ashwin - Warner rocks back and then hammers the pull wide of mid-on. one bounce and over the ropes
Ashwin to Warner, 1 run, flighted delivery on off, eased down to long-on for a single
Ashwin to Rossouw, 1 run, pushed through around middle, Rossouw backs away and punches it back at the bowler, who is slow to get down and concedes a run
Holder to Rossouw, 1 run, short of a good length and angling back into the left-hander, Rossouw is cramped for room on the drive, squeezes an under- edge that rolled to the off-side
Back to over the wicket
Holder to Warner, , , tad too full from Holder - Warner gets forward and then drives it over mid-off, bounces away to the ropes in a hurry
Holder to Warner, no run, good comeback from Holder - shortens the length and gets it to seam away with the angle, lures Warner into a loose poke and beats him on the outside edge
Holder to Warner, no run, short of a good length and angling across the left-hander, Warner cuts and cuts it straight to the fielder at cover-point
Holder to Warner, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off, Warner toe-ends the drive towards cover and is off for a quick single
Back to round the wicket
Holder to Rossouw, , the bouncer from Holder, but it sails over Rossouw's head and is called as a wide
Holder to Rossouw, , , width on offer and Rossouw throws his hands on the cut, carves it up and over backward point, one bounce and over the ropes -
Ashwin to Warner, no run, tossed up just outside off, driven straight to the fielder at cover
Ashwin to Warner, , Ashwin darts one quicker and down leg, past Warner's pull and is called as a wide
Ashwin to Warner, 1 run, flatter and just outside off, chopped to the left of cover who makes a diving half-stop
Ashwin to Rossouw, 2 runs, loopy delivery down leg, flicked uppishly and to the left of mid-wicket, comes back for the second
Ashwin to Rossouw,  Caught!!

Ashwin to Rossouw,  Caught by Jaiswal!! A soft soft dismissal for Rossouw - was way too early into the reverse sweep and scooped a simple catch to cover-point. Nice bit of flight and some extra bounce for the off-spinner - Rossouw was committed to the shot, but was a tad too early into it, lobbed in the air and Jaiswal completes the catch, diving forward. DC slipping away once again.
Ashwin to Lalit Yadav, no run, tossed up just outside off, Lalit leans forward and pushes it to cover-point
Ashwin to Lalit Yadav, 2 runs, the off-break from Ashwin, Lalit plays with the turn and nudges it softly towards wide mid-on, scampers back for the second
Chahal to Warner, 1 run, very full and at the stumps, drivem down to long-on for a single
Chahal to Lalit Yadav, no run, Chahal tosses one one off, pushed back at the bowler
Chahal to Lalit Yadav, no run, Lalit comes down the pitch to this leg-break, leans across and pushes it back at the bowler
Chahal to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, Chahal tosses one just outside off, driven down to long-off for a single
Chahal to Warner, 1 run, flighted delivery on off, eased down to long-on for a single
Chahal to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, nice bit of flight on middle, worked down to long-on for a single
Buttler has walked off. Murugan has been brought in as an impact player.
Sandeep Sharma to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, angles in a length delivery, the batter nudges the ball down to mid-wicket for a single. That nipped in from a length and Lalit Yadav played it a little late
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, 1 run, clips a fuller length delivery which nipped in and the man at mid-wicket dived to allow a single only
Sandeep Sharma to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, fuller length delivery again, Lalit Yadav clips the ball down to long-on for a single. That was too full from Sandeep Sharma
"Too many cooks spoil the broth," as the saying goes. This is the case with DC, which has so many legends managing the team.
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, 1 run, drills the ball down wide of long-off for a single as that was angled across the southpaw. Was full and wide for the batter to hit it on the up

Sandeep Sharma to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, another single. Short ball, Lalit Yadav gets on top of the ball and thumps the ball down to deep mid for a single. That was hit hard but found the fielder on the on-side

Sandeep Sharma to Warner, 1 run, right up there and has been jammed out into the off-side for a single. That was dug out nicely by the Aussie. Six singles in the over and DC yet to get hang of the chase so far
Boult to Warner, 1 run, angles the ball in, Warner hangs back and tucks the ball down into the on-side for a single
Boult to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, and another single down to third man as the batter went for a drive only to slice it down to the deep fielder
Boult to Warner, , short ball and hammered! Was banged in short, Warner gets on top of the ball and pulls it hard behind square for a four. . His consistency has been second to none in this league
Boult to Warner, 1 run, nudges the ball down on to the on-side for a single as it angled in
Boult to Lalit Yadav, , short ball, outside off, Lalit Yadav goes back and slashes the ball past point for a four. That was timed and placed really well
Boult to Lalit Yadav, 2 runs, angles it in, Lalit Yadav clips the ball wide of long-on for a couple of runs
DC needed one to reassess the situation. They are well behind in the chase. Warner is there and has to ensure he takes the mantle himself to deliver. Else DC will fall again.
Ashwin to Warner, 1 run, backs away and chops the ball down to deep cover for a single. They harboured thoughts of a second but had to be content with a single

Ashwin to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, and singles won't harm RR much. He was beaten in flight as he danced down and the leading edge went down to long-off. Was a tossed up delivery and Lalit Yadav closed the bat face a little too early
Ashwin to Warner, 1 run, tossed up delivery, Warner gets forward and pushes the ball down to long-off for a single
What's point of holding back Powell? The asking rate is over 12 already, not bringing in a big hitter isn't going to help the team's cause.
Ashwin to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, allows the ball to turn in and nudges the ball down on to the on-side for a single. Played it late
Ashwin to Warner, , slips one down leg, that turned but Warner let it go to earn a wide
Ashwin to Warner, no run, flatter one, outside off, Warner gets forward and stabs it down to cover
Ashwin to Warner, , spins down leg again, Warner misses the tuck and has been wided again
Ashwin to Warner, 1 run, keeps it flatter, slower, Warner hangs back and tucks it down on to the on-side for a single. They didn't opt for the second
There is decent batting left in the form of Powell and Axar. DC will have to decide when they have to explode. Time seems to be running out.
Chahal to Warner, 2 runs, gets that off the pads and away from the man at deep square for a couple of runs. Again played it late
Chahal to Warner, 1 run, and gets it down to deep mid for a single after it was dragged down by Chahal. Was very short, slower, Warner waited on it to pull it down to deep mid

Chahal to Lalit Yadav, , and much needed! DC will take it with open arms. Lalit Yadav decided to go for the reverse sweep and managed to send it over the infield behind square on the off-side. Managed to get enough wood to a delivery lured up outside off
Chahal to Lalit Yadav, , and pressure! The bowler floats that well wide and Lalit Yadav lets it go to earn a wide
Chahal to Lalit Yadav, , and four again! Gets another reverse hack and places it past point for a four. Was a fuller ball and Lalit Yadav managed to squeeze it into the gap. Big over so far
Chahal to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, and kneels down to slam a slog sweep to deep square. Was a delivery at the sticks and Lalit Yadav sat down to put it away

Chahal to Warner, 2 runs, and powers that on to the on-side and Hetmyer does well to cut it off. Decent release as well. Only a couple. The fielder dived to his left to stop it after Warner managed to drag it away on to the on-side

Holder to Lalit Yadav, , what happened there? Was a very short ball, slower, Lalit Yadav manages to drag the pull and get it over the keeper as well as fine four a four. Was a poor delivery and Lalit Yadav somehow managed to put it away
Holder to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, stabs the ball down into the off-side for a single as that was a length delivery
Holder to Warner, 1 run, fuller delivery angled in from round the wicket and Warner on-drives the ball down to long-on for a single. The batter didn't get much room to work with

Holder to Lalit Yadav, 2 runs, clips that away but fails to beat the man at deep mid for a couple of runs. That was angled on to the pads, Lalit Yadav put it away into the gap on the on-side. Duo of runs added to the tally
Holder to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, backs away to a short ball, slower as well, Lalit Yadav dabs the ball down to third man for a single
Holder to Warner, 1 run, fuller length delivery angled in, Warner clips the ball down to deep mid for a single
Still more than 100 needed.
Boult to Warner, 1 run, gets a fuller ball, Warner push drives it down to long-on for a single. Time certainly is running out. But DC have done better since the last time-out...they need more
Boult to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, angles in a full toss, Lalit Yadav slices the ball down to deep cover for a single
Boult to Warner, no run, slower length delivery, outside off, Warner looks to slash at one and misses
Boult to Warner, no run, slower length delivery, outside off, Warner looks to slash at one and misses

Boult to Warner, 1 run, dropped a little short, Warner pulls that down and gets it wide of deep fine for a single. Lalit wanted a second and then had wandered out for some time before dragging his bat down inside the crease. Samson made an appeal and the third umpire dismissed it quickly
Boult to Lalit Yadav, , and drills it over mid-off for a four! Was a length delivery, Lalit Yadav backed away a little and got under the ball to pump it over mid-off. That sped away to the fence
Boult to Lalit Yadav,  Bowled!!

Boult to Lalit Yadav,  Bowled!! Full and straight and gone. That was right up there and Lalit Yadav went for an ugly hoick across the line to miss it. You miss and I hit comes true again. Lalit Yadav had to go for it and has to depart now. End of a good little knock from him but the team needed more from him. Boult ends with a three wicket haul. Another excellent game for him. He managed to do some damage with the new ball and now has come back to pick another one.
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, 1 run, fuller one, angled across, outside off, driven down to long-on for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Axar, no run, length delivery, curls in a little, tucked down to the man at mid-wicket. Little shape for Sandeep Sharma as the ball tailed in. His spell has been good so far
Sandeep Sharma to Axar, no run, another vital dot. The rate creeps up. Was a back of a length delivery, Axar backs away and looks to drive it through the covers but finds the man at cover
Sandeep Sharma to Axar, 1 run, fuller length delivery, Axar drags it down to long-on for a single. That came off the inner half of the bat and was dragged away sans much timing
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, no run, right up there, Warner jams it back to the bowler. That was fuller, tailed in and Warner squeezed it back
Sandeep Sharma to Warner, , misses the yorker and Warner clips the ball away to deep mid for a four. That was hit away into the gap just past the dive from the man at mid-wicket
Chahal to Axar, leg byes, 1 run, down on to the pads, Axar looks to slog sweep and misses. The ball rolls off the pads for a single
Chahal to Warner, 1 run, hammers that off the back foot to find deep mid for a single
Chahal to Axar, 1 run, goes back and slams the pull back to the bowler who fumbles and allows a single. That was a little fumble
Chahal to Warner, 1 run, hammered! That was hit flat and hard. The man at deep mid picks it up and relays it back. They get a single
Chahal to Axar, , slips one down leg, Axar looks to slog it away and misses. Has been wided
Chahal to Axar, , slips one down leg, Axar looks to slog it away and misses. Has been wided
Chahal to Axar,  Stumped!!

Chahal to Axar,  Stumped!! Was it a googly? The batter dances down and misses the line to be stumped. That infact was a tossed up delivery and turned in a little to beat the batter in flight. He never got to the pitch of the ball and that plotted his downfall. Fifth one down and DC will be hurt by his departure. The batter jumped out too soon I reckon.
Chahal to Powell, 2 runs, gets that square of the wicket and gets a brace. Was bowled flatter by Chahal

Ashwin to Warner, , and gets that away for a four! Was a flatter one, Warner hung back and slammed it past deep cover.  His good run continues but he needs to improve his strike-rate. That has been a bone of contention for him
Ashwin to Warner, 1 run, drags one down to long-on for a single as that was tossed up outside off
Ashwin to Powell,  Caught!!

Ashwin to Powell,  Caught by Hetmyer!! Dances down, the batter heaves it across the line and the man at deep mid takes it. The fielder misjudged it a little before recovering in time. Was very nicely doled up and the batter fell prey to the well floated up delivery. That should put the chase further into doldrums. Ashwin has managed to bargain another wicket.
The time-out was taken after the fall of Powell. DC need plenty of runs.
Ashwin to Abishek Porel, no run, gets forward and stabs the ball out into the off-side
Ashwin to Abishek Porel, no run, and darts in from a length. Abishek Porel lunged forward to push at it and got an inside edge
Ashwin to Abishek Porel, no run, gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler

Murugan Ashwin to Warner, 3 runs, sits down, goes for the reverse hack and lofts the ball away wide of deep cover. The ball lands short of the deep fielder and they get a brace. That wasn't timed at all. Infact, they have come back for a triple
Murugan Ashwin to Abishek Porel, 1 run, and another run. Singles shouldn't both RR at all. But Warner will be on strike
Murugan Ashwin to Warner, 2 runs, and hammers the pull away for a couple more. Little fumble allowed the second
Murugan Ashwin to Warner, 2 runs, takes on the arm of the fielder on the on-side and gets a brace as the throw came in at the bowler's end. That was on the pads and Warner tucked it away to deep mid
Murugan Ashwin to Warner, 2 runs, takes on the arm of the fielder on the on-side and gets a brace as the throw came in at the bowler's end. That was on the pads and Warner tucked it away to deep mid

What has happened now? Jaiswal has taken the catch of Warner. But they are checking whether there were required number of fielders inside the circle or not. Jaiswal should have been inside the circle for this ball. But he is outside the 30 yards. That should be a no-ball! Warner will come back...

Murugan Ashwin to Warner, , that was a dragged down googly, the batter went back to loft it over cover but failed to time it. The man at cover - Jaiswal - went back to take it. He celebrated a little early as the third umpire later figured out that he was outside the ring and this one turns out to be a no-ball
Murugan Ashwin to Warner, 1 run, changes his stance to go for the switch hit but gets a huge leading edge as he tried to hit it too hard. The ball went straight up and they get a single
Murugan Ashwin to Abishek Porel, 1 run, pokes the ball down into the off-side for a single as that was outside off
School boy error from the young man - Jaiswal. He was outside the circle and that has allowed Warner to continue.
Holder to Abishek Porel, leg byes, 1 run, looks to pull it and fails to time it. They get a single
Holder to Warner, 1 run, fuller delivery, shapes in and Warner clips the ball down to deep mid. They thought of a second but didn't risk it
Holder to Abishek Porel, 1 run, fuller ball, right up there. Abishek Porel backs away and stabs it down into the off-side for a single
Holder to Warner, no run, charges out, meets the low full toss and flays it down to find the man at cover. They don't have an interest in taking the single
Holder to Warner, 1 run, and he is all over the place as he flays that down to deep cover for a single. Was a fuller ball, Warner mistimes it
Holder to Abishek Porel, , slower delivery, outside off, Abishek Porel gets under it and slams it over cover for a four. That was so well timed by Abishek Porel
Chahal to Warner, 1 run, dropped short, Warner walks across his sticks and pulls that wide of deep square for a single
Chahal to Abishek Porel,  Caught!!

Chahal to Abishek Porel,  Caught by Hetmyer!! Looks to flog one across the line and finds the man at deep mid. Simple take indeed. Didn't connect well at all. Was well looped up and Abishek Porel just couldn't time it. That came off the inner half of the bat and went straight to the fielder in the deep.
Chahal to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, looks to heave it away but fails to beat the man at short fine
Chahal to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, preempts the reverse lap, misses. Kul being fooled by Cha. That was very well tossed up and turned a little as well
Chahal to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, preempts the reverse lap, misses. Kul being fooled by Cha. That was very well tossed up and turned a little as well
Chahal to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, preempts the reverse lap, misses. Kul being fooled by Cha. That was very well tossed up and turned a little as well
Chahal to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, drives the ball down to long-off as that was well doled up outside off
Chahal to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, drives the ball down to long-off as that was well doled up outside off

The umpire waited for a long time before raising his finger. Warner has decided to review the call. That was a tossed up delivery, Warner went for the reverse sweep and missed. That hit him almost on his chest as he was crouching down while trying to play the reverse hit. There is no bat on it.

The umpire waited for a long time before raising his finger. Warner has decided to review the call. That was a tossed up delivery, Warner went for the reverse sweep and missed. That hit him almost on his chest as he was crouching down while trying to play the reverse hit. There is no bat on it.
Chahal to Warner,  Lbw!!
Chahal to Warner,  Lbw!!

Chahal to Warner,  Lbw!! And three reds! His troubles have ended as well. End of an indifferent knock from the southpaw. That was well tossed up, the batter was a little early into the reverse sweep and missed the line. He went for the review but in vain. That was dipping as well and hence Warner lost the review as well.

Chahal to Warner,  Lbw!! And three reds! His troubles have ended as well. End of an indifferent knock from the southpaw. That was well tossed up, the batter was a little early into the reverse sweep and missed the line. He went for the review but in vain. That was dipping as well and hence Warner lost the review as well.
Sandeep Sharma to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, gets that away on to the on-side for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, gets that away on to the on-side for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Nortje,  Bowled!!
Sandeep Sharma to Nortje,  Bowled!!

Sandeep Sharma to Nortje,  Bowled!! Slower delivery, Nortje looks to slog and misses. The ball shatters the wood work. 9th one down. Was a slower delivery, at the sticks, Nortje was too early into the slog on the on-side. He didn't read the disguise on the ball. Sandeep has had a game so far.

Sandeep Sharma to Nortje,  Bowled!! Slower delivery, Nortje looks to slog and misses. The ball shatters the wood work. 9th one down. Was a slower delivery, at the sticks, Nortje was too early into the slog on the on-side. He didn't read the disguise on the ball. Sandeep has had a game so far.
Sandeep Sharma to Mukesh Kumar, 1 run, keeps it full and dragged across the line for a single. Plenty of runs needed
Sandeep Sharma to Mukesh Kumar, 1 run, keeps it full and dragged across the line for a single. Plenty of runs needed
Sandeep Sharma to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, fuller ball, angled across, outside off, Kuldeep Yadav looked to drive and misses it. Was a length delivery and decked away to beat the bat
Sandeep Sharma to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, fuller ball, angled across, outside off, Kuldeep Yadav looked to drive and misses it. Was a length delivery and decked away to beat the bat
Sandeep Sharma to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, charges down the track and looks to power it but ends up slicing the ball down to point. They don't get a single
Sandeep Sharma to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, charges down the track and looks to power it but ends up slicing the ball down to point. They don't get a single

Sandeep Sharma to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, crouches low, goes for the sweep and finds the man at short fine. A single reduces the margin of defeat by one more run.  Meek capitulaton indeed. RR pick up another win and have got their campaign back on track after the little hiccups they had against the Punjab side in the last game

Sandeep Sharma to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, crouches low, goes for the sweep and finds the man at short fine. A single reduces the margin of defeat by one more run.  Meek capitulaton indeed. RR pick up another win and have got their campaign back on track after the little hiccups they had against the Punjab side in the last game

DC have literally crawled to 142 in a chase of 200. The same story on loop for them ever since the start of the tourney. Warner once again snailed to a fifty and that at best has reduced the margin of defeat. Once Boult got two wickets in the first over, DC never looked like chasing this down. It seemed as if they were batting on a different track as compared to the RR side. Lalit Yadav and Warner tried to infuse some energy into the chase but failed to bridge the gap much as the rate required continued to grow. Once Lalit was dismissed, the formalities were left to be addressed. Earlier, Jaiswal and Buttler once again went bonkers to set it up for RR. They threatened to get more but settled for 199 after losing a few wickets in the middle overs. RR have picked up two wins now from three games and would be chuffed as well because they have given some facelift to their NRR as well.

It seemed as if they were batting on a different track as compared to the RR side. Lalit Yadav and Warner tried to infuse some energy into the chase but failed to bridge the gap much as the rate required continued to grow. Once Lalit was dismissed, the formalities were left to be addressed. Earlier, Jaiswal and Buttler once again went bonkers to set it up for RR. RR have picked up two wins now from three games and would be chuffed as well because they have given some facelift to their NRR as well.

When you are chasing 200, you need to start well. Can't take the credit away from Trent Boult. He was really good. It is just about executing your skills. We had a couple of chop ons last evening. We are professionals. We need to work it out. It is frustrating to hit to the fielders. One of our strike bowlers went down as well. Just didn't go to plan.

When you are chasing 200, you need to start well. Can't take the credit away from Trent Boult. He was really good. It is just about executing your skills. We had a couple of chop ons last evening. We are professionals. We need to work it out. It is frustrating to hit to the fielders. One of our strike bowlers went down as well. Just didn't go to plan.

Almost everything went to plan. I think me not scoring runs didn't go plan (laughs). The way I play this format I take a few balls to settle in and then go out there and express myself. Those 40-50 runs at a quick rate with Jos going through with his business. My role in the team is very clear. Just got the feel I would take that kind of a catch. Last game when we played here, it was a swimming pool and we were not able to keep the ball dry. We will have to get used to wet balls. Yuzi and Ash bhai know how to do it with the wet ball. I think Ashwin is always looking at the batter. The ball being new was very crucial for us and Ash bhai got through two important overs.

Almost everything went to plan. I think me not scoring runs didn't go plan (laughs). The way I play this format I take a few balls to settle in and then go out there and express myself. Those 40-50 runs at a quick rate with Jos going through with his business. My role in the team is very clear. Just got the feel I would take that kind of a catch. Last game when we played here, it was a swimming pool and we were not able to keep the ball dry. We will have to get used to wet balls. Yuzi and Ash bhai know how to do it with the wet ball. I think Ashwin is always looking at the batter. The ball being new was very crucial for us and Ash bhai got through two important overs.

I have worked hard. Trying to express myself. Learning is important for me. Growing as a young player is important for me. In my mind, I was like if it is a loose ball I will hit it. I think everything I learn from Buttler. I try to see how he practises. I knew I can take on a few bowlers. I didn't know. Sanju bhai said 'koi baat nahin theek hai' (Sanju Samson said It is ok when he got to know about the no-ball which resulted when Jaiswal took the catch after being outside the circle.)

I think everything I learn from Buttler. I try to see how he practises. I knew I can take on a few bowlers. I didn't know. RR would be delighted with the win. They hardly broke much sweat to clinch this. Early days in the tournament but they will be happy with the consistency that they have shown so far. DC will be sweating now. They look listless and clueless. They don't know which problem to fix. Warner, their skipper, has gotten two fifties and still looks out of place. The spin duo of Kuldeep and Axar also haven't been able to exert any kind of pressure. Nortje has been expensive and the list is endless. So, hop tabs and follow the El Clasico!

RR would be delighted with the win. They hardly broke much sweat to clinch this. Early days in the tournament but they will be happy with the consistency that they have shown so far. DC will be sweating now. They look listless and clueless. They don't know which problem to fix. Warner, their skipper, has gotten two fifties and still looks out of place. The spin duo of Kuldeep and Axar also haven't been able to exert any kind of pressure. Nortje has been expensive and the list is endless. So, hop tabs and follow the El Clasico!
